doc:
Antonio Casas https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antonio_Casas 0 Antonio Casas (11 November 1911 in A Coruña, Galicia, Spain – 14 February 1982 in Madrid, Spain) was a Spanish footballer turned film actor who appeared in film between 1941 and his death in 1982. Casas originally began as a footballer for Atlético Madrid, but entered film in 1941 and made nearly 170 appearances in film and TV between then and 1982. He appeared in A Pistol for Ringo in 1965 and Sergio Leone's Spaghetti Western The Good, the Bad and the Ugly in 1966. One of his best-known roles was in Luis Buñuel's Tristana. In the early 1970s he worked in television but returned to film after 1975 until his death. He died on 14 February 1982 in Madrid at age 70. Antonio_Casas ( 11_November_1911 in A_Coruña , Galicia , Spain – 14_February_1982 in Madrid , Spain ) was a_Spanish_footballer turned film_actor who appeared in film between 1941 and his_death in 1982 . Casas originally began as a_footballer for Atlético_Madrid , but entered film in 1941 and made nearly_170_appearances in film_and_TV between then_and_1982 . He appeared in A_Pistol for Ringo in 1965 and Sergio_Leone 's_Spaghetti_Western_The_Good , the_Bad and the_Ugly in 1966 . One of his_best-known_roles was in Luis_Buñuel 's_Tristana . In the_early_1970s he worked in television but returned to film after 1975 until his_death . He died on 14_February_1982 in Madrid at age_70 .
